To make the input tags uneditable after submitting a row, you can introduce another state variable to keep track of the submitted rows. Then, you can conditionally render the input tags as disabled based on the submitted rows. Here's the modified code:

jsx
import React, { useState } from 'react';
import { Container, Row, Col, Button, Form } from 'react-bootstrap';

const InputGrid = () => {
  const [inputValues, setInputValues] = useState([[""]]);
  const [workflow, setWorkflow] = useState([]);
  const [submittedRows, setSubmittedRows] = useState([]);

  const handleInputChange = (rowIndex, colIndex, event) => {
    const { value } = event.target;

    setInputValues(prevInputValues => {
      const newInputValues = prevInputValues.map((row, rIndex) => {
        if (rIndex === rowIndex) {
          return row.map((col, cIndex) => (cIndex === colIndex ? value : col));
        }
        return row;
      });

      return newInputValues;
    });
  };

  const addRow = () => {
    if (submittedRows.includes(inputValues.length - 1)) {
      setInputValues(prevInputValues => [...prevInputValues, [""]]);
    }
  };

  const handleSubmitRow = (rowIndex) => {
    const rowStates = inputValues[rowIndex].filter(value => value.trim() !== "");
    const isRowFilled = rowStates.length === inputValues[rowIndex].length;

    if (isRowFilled) {
      console.log(rowStates); // Print the submitted row in the console
      setWorkflow(prevWorkflow => [...prevWorkflow, [rowStates]]); // Add the rowStates as a new array inside the workflow array
      setSubmittedRows(prevSubmittedRows => [...prevSubmittedRows, rowIndex]);
    }
  };

  const addColumn = (rowIndex) => {
    if (!submittedRows.includes(rowIndex)) {
      const lastColIndex = inputValues[rowIndex].length - 1;
      const isLastColFilled = inputValues[rowIndex][lastColIndex].trim() !== "";

      if (isLastColFilled) {
        setInputValues(prevInputValues => {
          const newInputValues = [...prevInputValues];
          newInputValues[rowIndex] = [...newInputValues[rowIndex], ""];
          return newInputValues;
        });
      }
    }
  };

  const deleteColumn = (rowIndex, colIndex) => {
    if (!submittedRows.includes(rowIndex)) {
      setInputValues(prevInputValues => {
        const newInputValues = [...prevInputValues];
        newInputValues[rowIndex] = newInputValues[rowIndex].filter((col, index) => index !== colIndex);
        return newInputValues;
      });
    }
  };

  return (
    <Container>
      <Button variant="primary" onClick={addRow} disabled={inputValues.length > 0 && !submittedRows.includes(inputValues.length - 1)}>
        Add Row
      </Button>

      <Container>
        {inputValues.map((row, rowIndex) => (
          <Row key={rowIndex} className="mb-3 align-items-center" style={{ display: 'flex' }}>
            {row.map((value, colIndex) => (
              <Col key={colIndex}>
                <Form.Control
                  type="text"
                  value={value}
                  onChange={event => handleInputChange(rowIndex, colIndex, event)}
                  disabled={submittedRows.includes(rowIndex)}
                />
                {!submittedRows.includes(rowIndex) && (
                  <Button
                    variant="danger"
                    onClick={() => deleteColumn(rowIndex, colIndex)}
                    disabled={submittedRows.includes(rowIndex)}
                  >
                    -
                  </Button>
                )}
              </Col>
            ))}
            {!submittedRows.includes(rowIndex) && (
              <>
                <Col>
                  <Button
                    variant="primary"
                    onClick={() => addColumn(rowIndex)}
                    disabled={!row.every(val => val.trim() !== "") || submittedRows.includes(rowIndex)}
                  >
                    Add Column
                  </Button>
                </Col>
                <Col>
                  <Button
                    variant="primary"
                    onClick={() => handleSubmitRow(rowIndex)}
                    disabled={!row.every(val => val.trim() !== "") || submittedRows.includes(rowIndex)}
                  >
                    Submit
                  </Button>
                </Col>
              </>
            )}
          </Row>
        ))}
      </Container>

      <Container>
        <h2>Workflow</h2>
        {workflow.map((rowStates, index) => (
          <div key={index}>
            {rowStates.map((state, stateIndex) => (
              <span key={stateIndex}>{state}</span>
            ))}
          </div>
        ))}
      </Container>
    </Container>
  );
};

export default InputGrid;

Now, the input tags will be disabled after submitting a row, preventing any further changes. Additionally, the "-" button and the add column button will be disabled for the submitted rows.

To add an edit button after row submission to edit the previously submitted row, you can modify the code as follows:

jsx
import React, { useState } from 'react';
import { Container, Row, Col, Button, Form } from 'react-bootstrap';

const InputGrid = () => {
  const [inputValues, setInputValues] = useState([[""]]);
  const [workflow, setWorkflow] = useState([]);
  const [submittedRows, setSubmittedRows] = useState([]);
  const [editRowIndex, setEditRowIndex] = useState(null);

  const handleInputChange = (rowIndex, colIndex, event) => {
    const { value } = event.target;

    setInputValues(prevInputValues => {
      const newInputValues = prevInputValues.map((row, rIndex) => {
        if (rIndex === rowIndex) {
          return row.map((col, cIndex) => (cIndex === colIndex ? value : col));
        }
        return row;
      });

      return newInputValues;
    });
  };

  const addRow = () => {
    if (submittedRows.includes(inputValues.length - 1)) {
      setInputValues(prevInputValues => [...prevInputValues, [""]]);
    }
  };

  const handleSubmitRow = (rowIndex) => {
    const rowStates = inputValues[rowIndex].filter(value => value.trim() !== "");
    const isRowFilled = rowStates.length === inputValues[rowIndex].length;

    if (isRowFilled) {
      console.log(rowStates); // Print the submitted row in the console
      
      if (editRowIndex !== null && submittedRows.includes(editRowIndex)) {
        setWorkflow(prevWorkflow => {
          const newWorkflow = [...prevWorkflow];
          newWorkflow[editRowIndex] = [rowStates];
          return newWorkflow;
        });
        setEditRowIndex(null);
      } else {
        setWorkflow(prevWorkflow => [...prevWorkflow, [rowStates]]); // Add the rowStates as a new array inside the workflow array
        setSubmittedRows(prevSubmittedRows => [...prevSubmittedRows, rowIndex]);
      }
    }
  };

  const addColumn = (rowIndex) => {
    if (!submittedRows.includes(rowIndex)) {
      const lastColIndex = inputValues[rowIndex].length - 1;
      const isLastColFilled = inputValues[rowIndex][lastColIndex].trim() !== "";

      if (isLastColFilled) {
        setInputValues(prevInputValues => {
          const newInputValues = [...prevInputValues];
          newInputValues[rowIndex] = [...newInputValues[rowIndex], ""];
          return newInputValues;
        });
      }
    }
  };

  const deleteColumn = (rowIndex, colIndex) => {
    if (!submittedRows.includes(rowIndex)) {
      setInputValues(prevInputValues => {
        const newInputValues = [...prevInputValues];
        newInputValues[rowIndex] = newInputValues[rowIndex].filter((col, index) => index !== colIndex);
        return newInputValues;
      });
    }
  };

  const handleEditRow = (rowIndex) => {
    setEditRowIndex(rowIndex);
    setInputValues(prevInputValues => prevInputValues.map((row, rIndex) => (rIndex === rowIndex ? row : row.map(() => ""))));
  };

  return (
    <Container>
      <Button variant="primary" onClick={addRow} disabled={inputValues.length > 0 && !submittedRows.includes(inputValues.length - 1)}>
        Add Row
      </Button>

      <Container>
        {inputValues.map((row, rowIndex) => (
          <Row key={rowIndex} className="mb-3 align-items-center" style={{ display: 'flex' }}>
            {row.map((value, colIndex) => (
              <Col key={colIndex}>
                <Form.Control
                  type="text"
                  value={value}
                  onChange={event => handleInputChange(rowIndex, colIndex, event)}
                  disabled={submittedRows.includes(rowIndex)}
                />
                {!submittedRows.includes(rowIndex) && (
                  <Button variant="danger" onClick={() => deleteColumn(rowIndex, colIndex)}>-</Button>
                )}
              </Col>
            ))}
            {!submittedRows.includes(rowIndex) && (
              <>
                <Col>
                  <Button
                    variant="primary"
                    onClick={() => addColumn(rowIndex)}
                    disabled={!row.every(val => val.trim() !== "")}
                  >
                    Add Column
                  </Button>
                </Col>
                <Col>
                  <Button variant="primary" onClick={() => handleSubmitRow(rowIndex)}>
                    Submit
                  </Button>
                </Col>
              </>
            )}
            {submittedRows.includes(rowIndex) && (
              <Col>
                <Button variant="primary" onClick={() => handleEditRow(rowIndex)}>
                  Edit
                </Button>
              </Col>
            )}
          </Row>
        ))}
      </Container>

      <Container>
        <h2>Workflow</h2>
        {workflow.map((rowStates, index) => (
          <div key={index}>
            {rowStates.map((state, stateIndex) => (
              <span key={stateIndex}>{state}</span>
            ))}
          </div>
        ))}
      </Container>
    </Container>
  );
};

export default InputGrid;

Now, after submitting a row, an edit button will be displayed for the submitted rows. Clicking the edit button will allow you to edit the previously submitted row.

Apologies for the confusion. To allow editing of the previously submitted row directly in the input fields, you can modify the code as follows:

import { Container, Row, Col, Button, Form } from 'react-bootstrap';

const InputGrid = () => {

  const [workflow, setWorkflow] = useState([]);
  const [submittedRows, setSubmittedRows] = useState([]);
  const [editRowIndex, setEditRowIndex] = useState(null);

            {rowStates.map((state, stateIndex) => (

To update the previously submitted row after editing, you can add a separate submit button for the edited row. Here's the modified code to include the submit button after editing:

jsx
import React, { useState } from 'react';
import { Container, Row, Col, Button, Form } from 'react-bootstrap';

const InputGrid = () => {
  const [inputValues, setInputValues] = useState([[""]]);
  const [workflow, setWorkflow] = useState([]);
  const [submittedRows, setSubmittedRows] = useState([]);
  const [editRowIndex, setEditRowIndex] = useState(null);

  const handleInputChange = (rowIndex, colIndex, event) => {
    const { value } = event.target;

    setInputValues(prevInputValues => {
      const newInputValues = prevInputValues.map((row, rIndex) => {
        if (rIndex === rowIndex) {
          return row.map((col, cIndex) => (cIndex === colIndex ? value : col));
        }
        return row;
      });

      return newInputValues;
    });
  };

  const addRow = () => {
    if (submittedRows.includes(inputValues.length - 1)) {
      setInputValues(prevInputValues => [...prevInputValues, [""]]);
    }
  };

  const handleSubmitRow = (rowIndex) => {
    const rowStates = inputValues[rowIndex].filter(value => value.trim() !== "");
    const isRowFilled = rowStates.length === inputValues[rowIndex].length;

    if (isRowFilled) {
      console.log(rowStates); // Print the submitted row in the console

      if (editRowIndex !== null && submittedRows.includes(editRowIndex)) {
        setWorkflow(prevWorkflow => {
          const newWorkflow = [...prevWorkflow];
          newWorkflow[editRowIndex] = rowStates;
          return newWorkflow;
        });
        setEditRowIndex(null);
      } else {
        setWorkflow(prevWorkflow => [...prevWorkflow, rowStates]); // Add the rowStates as a new array inside the workflow array
        setSubmittedRows(prevSubmittedRows => [...prevSubmittedRows, rowIndex]);
      }
    }
  };

  const addColumn = (rowIndex) => {
    if (!submittedRows.includes(rowIndex)) {
      const lastColIndex = inputValues[rowIndex].length - 1;
      const isLastColFilled = inputValues[rowIndex][lastColIndex].trim() !== "";

      if (isLastColFilled) {
        setInputValues(prevInputValues => {
          const newInputValues = [...prevInputValues];
          newInputValues[rowIndex] = [...newInputValues[rowIndex], ""];
          return newInputValues;
        });
      }
    }
  };

  const deleteColumn = (rowIndex, colIndex) => {
    if (!submittedRows.includes(rowIndex)) {
      setInputValues(prevInputValues => {
        const newInputValues = [...prevInputValues];
        newInputValues[rowIndex] = newInputValues[rowIndex].filter((col, index) => index !== colIndex);
        return newInputValues;
      });
    }
  };

  const handleEditRow = (rowIndex) => {
    setEditRowIndex(rowIndex);
    setInputValues(prevInputValues => [...prevInputValues.map((row, rIndex) => (rIndex === rowIndex ? row : row.map(() => "")))]);
  };

  const handleUpdateRow = (rowIndex) => {
    const rowStates = inputValues[rowIndex].filter(value => value.trim() !== "");
    const isRowFilled = rowStates.length === inputValues[rowIndex].length;

    if (isRowFilled) {
      console.log(rowStates); // Print the updated row in the console

      setWorkflow(prevWorkflow => {
        const newWorkflow = [...prevWorkflow];
        newWorkflow[rowIndex] = rowStates;
        return newWorkflow;
      });

      setEditRowIndex(null);
    }
  };

  return (
    <Container>
      <Button variant="primary" onClick={addRow}>Add Row</Button>

      <Container>
        {inputValues.map((row, rowIndex) => (
          <Row key={rowIndex} className="mb-3 align-items-center" style={{ display: 'flex' }}>
            {row.map((value, colIndex) => (
              <Col key={colIndex}>
                <Form.Control
                  type="text"
                  value={value}
                  onChange={event => handleInputChange(rowIndex, colIndex, event)}
                  disabled={submittedRows.includes(rowIndex) && rowIndex !== editRowIndex}
                />
                {!submittedRows.includes(rowIndex) && (
                  <Button variant="danger" onClick={() => deleteColumn(rowIndex, colIndex)}>-</Button>
                )}
              </Col>
            ))}
            {!submittedRows.includes(rowIndex) && (
              <>
                <Col>
                  <Button
                    variant="primary"
                    onClick={() => addColumn(rowIndex)}
                    disabled={!row.every(val => val.trim() !== "")}
                  >
                    Add Column
                  </Button>
                </Col>
                <Col>
                  <Button variant="primary" onClick={() => handleSubmitRow(rowIndex)}>
                    Submit
                  </Button>
                </Col>
              </>
            )}
            {submittedRows.includes(rowIndex) && (
              <Col>
                {!editRowIndex && (
                  <Button variant="primary" onClick={() => handleEditRow(rowIndex)}>
                    Edit
                  </Button>
                )}
                {editRowIndex === rowIndex && (
                  <Button variant="primary" onClick={() => handleUpdateRow(rowIndex)}>
                    Update
                  </Button>
                )}
              </Col>
            )}
          </Row>
        ))}
      </Container>

      <Container>
        <h2>Workflow</h2>
        {workflow.map((rowStates, index) => (
          <div key={index}>
            {rowStates.map((state, stateIndex) => (
              <span key={stateIndex}>{state}</span>
            ))}
          </div>
        ))}
      </Container>
    </Container>
  );
};

export default InputGrid;

Now, after editing a row, an "Update" button is displayed, which allows you to update the previously submitted row in the workflow array. The input fields of the edited row become editable again, and the updated row is logged in the console.

after update the previous one deleted or not jus a questio answer
1 / 1

No, the previous row is not deleted when you update it. The updated row replaces the previous row in the workflow array. The original workflow array remains intact, and only the specific row gets updated with the new values.

1 / 1
i means it get replaced isnt it??
1 / 1

Apologies for the confusion. Yes, when you update a previously submitted row, it gets replaced with the updated values in the workflow array. The original row is overwritten with the updated row, and the changes are reflected in the workflow array. The rest of the rows remain unaffected.

Apologies for the oversight. To disable the submit button when no data is entered in the input columns for the entire row, you can modify the code as follows:

jsx
<Col>
  <Button
    variant="primary"
    onClick={() => handleSubmitRow(rowIndex)}
    disabled={row.every(val => val.trim() === "")}
  >
    Submit
  </Button>
</Col>

By checking if every value in the row array is empty or contains only whitespace, we can determine whether any input column is empty. If all columns are empty, the submit button will be disabled.
